CatDescriptText: Mr. Richard Hale, single, porter, 204 Henning Place, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 26, 1959, pg. A1, with question: "Do you believe in divorce even though most religious groups frown upon it, and some actually ban it except under very extenuating circumstances?" answer reads: "I definitely do. When persons can not get along, they should be separated because they are not suited and will make themselves miserable."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Richard Hale wearing leather jacket with fabric sleeves and trim and eyeglasses, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, with Thrift Drugs store in background, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
